meanings.definition: Unleavened bread traditionally eaten during Passover.
meanings.sent1: During Passover, we always have matzas on the table.
meanings.sent2: My family enjoys eating matzas with charoset during the holiday.
meanings.sent3: The matzas decided to have a dance party on the Seder plate.
meanings.sent4: The matzas, like humble soldiers, stood firm on the plate.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked matzas filled the kitchen, reminding us of tradition.
